ratings.comment: Pop quiz-group participation projects in class, he may or may not tell you beforehand. Quizzes were sequentially more difficult than the last (4 total). Tobin is a nice and a researcher, and explains fairly well. However, his quizzes were vastly different and difficult because they cover some very minor details missed WO notes; CLOSE note quizzes.

This class is about natural disasters. If you have the chance to take this do yourself a favor and enroll. Prof. Tobin is awesome. He keeps lectures interesting and he's a funny guy. Class is super interesting and out of class work is super manageable. No textbook, no cumulative final. This has been my favorite course I've gotten to take @ UW.

Prof. Tobin is clearly very passionate about Geology. He tries his hardest to make lectures about rocks interesting and usually succeeds. The midterms were okay, not too hard but not easy. The labs are tedious and hard to finish in the class time. Overall pretty easy course if you keep up with the labs and study for the exams. Overall grade curved

Tobin is a great lecturer who's clearly passionate about geology. The labs are a very important part of your grade; get help from your TA for them. Midterm and final were both fair, you're just expected to know a lot. My advice would be to study geology each week so you won't be cramming the night before the exams.

Great guy. He cares about his field and it shows so much in his lectures. I took this course only to complete a science credit, so having no interest in geology i was nervous to take this course. However, he at least sparked some interest in the field for me and made it easy to learn about. Textbook is not neccessary but really helps when studying.
He is an awesome lecture and the tests are fair and graded fairly.

Professor Tobin tries to make this super boring topic seem interesting to people who are just taking the course to satisfy science credit. He comes every day more enthusiastic than the last and is passionate about what he's teaching. Participation is important and the labs can be hard, but you can always use your friends for help.
Material can get boring at times, but he tries to keep it interesting. Lots of cool pictures and videos during lecture.

There was many lectures where I had the urge to clap at the end. The content was so interesting and he knew what to highlight to keep you interested during class. Possibly the best professor Ive ever had.
FANTASTIC PROFESSOR

Prior to taking this class, I was really excited to learn more about Oceanography.  However, after a semester of this class, I could not be more happy to get out.  Tobin is enthusiastic about his work, but he does not get through his lectures because of his digressions.  Tests are random and misleading. Overall I would not recommend this class!

Very easy to follow. Puts notes up on online and not bad to loook at either. Very interesting. Talks about his work with geophysics and I am interested. I am not a science major. Nice class and a good end to my senior year.

The structure of the class makes it hard to get lower than a B, lab answers are hand fed to students, 10% of grade is participation and 5% extra credit paper.  Professor is nice but cares more about research than teaching. Test questions can be very random, class can be boring but is usually somewhat interesting.  Easy GPA boosting class.
No Comments

I went into this class not expecting much, but it really is a pretty decent class. He is a fun, easy going, and very informative professor. His tests are fair and the lab is easy! Make sure to go to class though, he asks clicker questions. Those count as participation, which is 10% of your grade.
He's so great.  He makes it fun and easy for you to get extra points.  He's also very funny.  The material isn't bad either.  Overall a really very enjoyable class!
One of the best lecturers I have ever encountered.  He could make any topic completely enthralling.  The only drawback is that anyone you have afterwards will be a monumental disappointment.
Very fun lectures. Laid back personality and is rather funny. Class has no homework, the only grades come from three tests. Really great professor!

It was so brave of him to admit he takes Snowball on the road to cat shows.  He's such a role model for me.  I hope one day I have the courage to be that open.  Oh yeah ... and the geology stuff was OK too.
No Comments
